title: How to Make San Choy Bau

steps.headline: Dice your bell pepper.
steps.description: Deseed your pepper and remove the stem. Slice the pepper in half using your knife. Cut those halves into strips, and cut those strips into dices. Place aside.

steps.headline: Grate your zucchini.
steps.description: Using your knife, cut the ends of the zucchini off and grate in the cheese grater. Place aside.

steps.headline: Prep your mince.
steps.description: To your beef, add the soy and oyster sauce and mix. Be careful not to knead the meat, otherwise you may make the proteins in the meat stick, causing lumps. If you can't not knead, use a fork. Place aside.

steps.headline: Oil your pan using your cooking spray.
steps.description: Don't be too generous though, especially when using a non-stick frypan.

steps.headline: Let your pan heat up.
steps.description: Put your an on high to heat the pan and oil. Wait for approx. 2-3 mins.

steps.headline: Caramelise your onion.
steps.description: Put the onion in the pan and keep them moving with your egg-flipper. You can tell they are finished when they have browned and start producing liquid.

steps.headline: Add your mince.
steps.description: Break up the pieces with your flipper quickly as they cook. This will take about 5-7 mins but keep an eye on it.

steps.headline: Gradually add your vegetables to the mix.
steps.description: At this point you can add more sauce(s). Continue cooking until the capsicum has gone soft.

steps.headline: While everything else is cooking, start to separate the lettuce leaves and make small cups of them.
Take the mince mix off the heat and prepare your lettuce cups.
steps.description: Be careful not to burn yourself.

steps.headline: Place the mince mix into the lettuce cups.
steps.description: Your San Choy Bau is ready to serve!

text: Preparing Dice your bell pepper. Deseed your pepper and remove the stem. Slice the pepper in half using your knife. Cut those halves into strips, and cut those strips into dices. Place aside. Grate your zucchini. Using your knife, cut the ends of the zucchini off and grate in the cheese grater. Place aside. Prep your mince. To your beef, add the soy and oyster sauce and mix. Be careful not to knead the meat, otherwise you may make the proteins in the meat stick, causing lumps. If you can't not knead, use a fork. Place aside. Dice your onion.  Cooking Oil your pan using your cooking spray. Don't be too generous though, especially when using a non-stick frypan. Let your pan heat up. Put your an on high to heat the pan and oil. Wait for approx. 2-3 mins. Caramelise your onion. Put the onion in the pan and keep them moving with your egg-flipper. You can tell they are finished when they have browned and start producing liquid. Add your mince. Break up the pieces with your flipper quickly as they cook. This will take about 5-7 mins but keep an eye on it. Gradually add your vegetables to the mix. At this point you can add more sauce(s). Continue cooking until the capsicum has gone soft. While everything else is cooking, start to separate the lettuce leaves and make small cups of them.  Serving Take the mince mix off the heat and prepare your lettuce cups. Be careful not to burn yourself. Place the mince mix into the lettuce cups. Your San Choy Bau is ready to serve!
